{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient has been on antibiotics and has had prolonged IV cannulation. This can lead to an infection due to the bacteria present on the skin or in the environment. Coagulase negative staphylococcus is a common cause of hospital-acquired infections, especially in patients with indwelling medical devices such as IV cannulas. Pseudomonas aerugenosa, Streptococcus agalactiae, and E. coli are less likely to cause infection in this scenario.", "answer_choice": "B. Coagulase negative staphylococcus"}
